name: 10-minute Hot and Sour Soup | Marion's Kitchen
description: For when you need comfort food fast – this is hearty, flavour-packed chicken soup in just 10 minutes. It’s a great way to use up leftover cooked chicken and tofu – as well as that pesky half a carrot that always seems to be in the crisper!
recipeIngredient: 1 cup (about 150g/5oz) cooked shredded chicken (left-over BBQ/rotisserie chicken is perfect)
3 tbsp cornflour (cornstarch), mixed with 3 tbsp water
finely chopped spring onion (scallions), to serve

recipeInstructions.text:
Step 1.Use a julienne peeler to shave thin strips of carrot into a saucepan..

Step 2.To the carrot, add the chicken, mushrooms, tofu, bamboo shoots and chicken stock. Place the saucepan over high heat and bring to a gentle simmer. Add pepper, soy sauces and vinegar.  Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 2-3 minutes or until mushrooms are just softened..

Step 3.Add cornstarch mixture to the soup and stir.  Simmer for another 3 minutes to thicken. Taste the soup and adjust seasoning to your taste. Add salt, vinegar and pepper to your liking. Ladle into bowls and sprinkle with spring onion..

NOTES: – Alternatively use pre-packaged carrot strips.
